;;该视频包含图形内容。以色列于周三（10 月 11 日）组建了紧急联合政府，袭击加沙以铲除哈马斯，并在人口稠密的巴勒斯坦飞地以北部署部队，武装分子表示，他们在跨境袭击后仍在当地进行战斗。 Olivia Chan 还有更多内容。;
;;
; ;2023 年 10 月 11 日，以色列对加沙城发动袭击后，浓烟滚滚。路透社/萨利赫·萨利姆;
;

;以色列于周三组建了紧急联合政府，其喷气式飞机袭击了加沙，坦克集结在巴勒斯坦飞地周围，军方表示，在附近以色列领土上的新对抗中，它杀死了三名哈马斯武装分子。

;

;总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡同意与前国防部长组建战时内阁甘茨领导的民族团结党发表联合声明称，以色列部长兼中间派反对党领袖本尼·甘茨将注意力集中在冲突上。

;

;以色列军方称，以色列死亡人数上升至 1,200 人，受伤人数超过 2,700 人，均由哈马斯武装分子造成周六，以色列突破包围加沙的边界围栏，大规模渗透到附近的以色列城镇和村庄，引发了周末的暴乱。

;

;加沙卫生部表示，以色列对封锁的加沙的报复性袭击已造成 1,100 人死亡，5,339 人受伤。哈马斯官员称，约 535 栋住宅楼被毁，约 25 万人无家可归。大多数流离失所者都在联合国指定的避难所中，其他人则挤在破碎的街道上。

;

;美国总统乔·拜登已发布;警告;似乎是针对哈马斯的伊朗支持者，不要利用加沙大火发动更广泛的中东战争。

;

;哈马斯的武装派系，卡萨姆旅表示，以色列境内周三仍在战斗，以色列军方表示，一辆坦克向加沙东北部郊外的尼尔阿姆基布兹附近的一辆汽车内的三名武装分子开火，将他们打死。

;

;以色列已在加沙附近部署了坦克和装甲车编队，可能准备对哈马斯统治的沿海飞地发动地面进攻。

;

;哈马斯武装部门表示，他们已用 R60 火箭袭击了以色列北部沿海城市海法。海法和附近城镇的警报响起后，没有立即报告人员伤亡。

;

;路透社电视台工作人员在以色列最北部的梅图拉附近看到一栋房屋被一枚明显的射弹击中，该地区靠近黎巴嫩南部边境，伊朗支持的全副武装的真主党组织很活跃。

;

;以色列发誓要迅速;对;75年历史上最致命的;巴勒斯坦激进分子袭击，导致音乐节和;基布兹社区;。

;

;军方表示，数十架战斗机袭击了 200 多人连夜袭击了加沙城一个街区的目标，据称这些目标被哈马斯用来发动袭击。

;

;以色列对加沙进行了“全面围困”，以阻止粮食和燃料到达 230 万人的飞地，许多穷人依赖援助。哈马斯媒体周三表示;停电了;在唯一的发电站停止工作后。

;

;由于巴勒斯坦救援人员不堪重负，拥挤的沿海地带的其他人也加入了在废墟中寻找尸体的行列。

;

;“我正在睡觉当房子倒塌压在我身上时，”一名男子哭着说，他和其他人在一座被导弹击中的建筑物的楼梯上用手电筒寻找被困人员。

;

;以色列军方表示，其部队在至少 1,000 名巴勒斯坦枪手在重新控制边境地区时从加沙渗透，总参谋长会见了指挥官讨论下一步行动。

;

;“只要有哈马斯领导人，以色列国防军就会发动袭击精确性和力量”，它指的是以色列军队。

;

;数十名以色列人和其他国外人士被带到加沙，;人质;，其中一些人被游街示众。双方均表示死伤者中有许多妇女和儿童，悲痛欲绝的亲属举行了;多次葬礼;。

;

;以色列称这是从周日起将学校改为远程学习，并向有执照的公民发放更多枪支，预计在呼吁更多抗议活动支持加沙的情况下，占多数的犹太人和阿拉伯少数民族之间可能会发生摩擦。

;

;以色列安全部队已;在被占领地区的冲突中杀害了至少 27 名巴勒斯坦人约旦河西岸自周六以来，巴勒斯坦派系呼吁巴勒斯坦领土上的人民在哈马斯从加沙发动袭击后奋起反抗。

;

;约旦河西岸城市纳布卢斯代理州长加桑·达格拉斯 (Ghassan Daghlas) 表示，巴勒斯坦人遭到枪击并据报道被以色列定居者打伤。路透社无法立即核实该报道，以色列也没有立即发表评论。

;

;危机扩大的另一个迹象是，;在强大的真主党连续第四天发生暴力事件后，以色列炮击;袭击了黎巴嫩南部城镇。< /p>;

;对加沙的地面进攻会给以色列带来风险，特别是对被困在这个狭窄且广泛城市化的飞地中的人质来说。哈马斯威胁要在没有警告的情况下处决每被击中的房屋一名俘虏。

;

;巴勒斯坦消息人士称，以色列隔夜空袭加沙的一处房屋导致哈马斯军事部门负责人穆罕默德·德伊夫的三名亲属死亡。 ="/world/middle-east/how-secretive-hamas-commander-masterthought-attack-israel-2023-10-10/">;这次袭击的秘密策划者;，计划了两年。;

;以色列在占领加沙 38 年后于 2005 年从加沙撤出定居者和军队。自哈马斯 2007 年在该飞地夺取政权以来，以色列的封锁造成了巴勒斯坦人认为无法容忍的条件。

;

;华盛顿表示正在与以色列和 ;埃及;关于食品供应短缺的加沙平民安全通行。

;

;总部位于约旦河西岸的巴勒斯坦权力机构官员侯赛因·谢赫表示，国际社会必须紧急干预，以避免“一场重大人道主义灾难”。

;

;拜登称哈马斯袭击为;“这是彻头彻尾的邪恶行为;”，并表示华盛顿正在紧急向以色列提供军事援助，包括补充其军事援助。铁穹防空系统。

;

;他敦促以色列避免造成平民伤亡，并表示美国通过移动;航母打击群;和战斗机。

;;2023 年 9 月 11 日，交易员在美国纽约市纽约证券交易所 (NYSE) 的交易大厅工作。 REUTERS/ Brendan McDermid/档案照片;
;

;在周三的震荡交易后，华尔街主要股指收高，美联储上次会议纪要的发布显示出政策制定者的谨慎态度，这有助于激发投资者对加息的希望。将保持稳定。

;

;美联储官员指出，经济、油价和金融市场的不确定性支持“;谨慎行事;以确定可能适当的额外政策紧缩程度，”根据周三发布的 9 月 11 日会议纪要。 19-20 日会议。

;

;周三交易波动较大，所有指数开盘均上涨，随后在会议纪要前转低，然后收复失地推高。

;

;爱德华·琼斯 (Edward Jones) 高级投资策略师 Angelo Kourkafas 表示，除了最近的利率走势和过去几天美联储官员的鸽派言论外，会议纪要似乎对投资者来说令人鼓舞。

;

;“今天的发布凸显了风险库尔卡法斯表示，“了解过度紧缩的情况，并了解过去三周利率发生的情况，这给投资者带来了一些安慰，因为我们不会看到再次加息。”

;

;但他指出，美联储即将做出的决定将考虑 9 月份消费者价格指数 (CPI) 数据，该数据将于周四开盘前公布，因为美联储的“数据依赖尚未消失。”

;

;周三早些时候，数据显示美国生产者价格上涨超过预期9 月份能源产品成本上涨，但工厂门口的潜在通胀压力继续缓和。

;

;

;

;Republicans who control the US House of Representatives on Wednesday nominated ;Steve Scalise; to serve as speaker following last week's ouster of ;Kevin McCarthy;, though it was unclear whether he had enough support to win a vote of the full chamber.

;

;Scalise, who is currently No. 2 on the Republican leadership ladder, must still win approval from the full House before he can claim the speaker's gavel. Republicans can afford only a handful of defections as they control the chamber by a narrow 221-212 majority and Democrats are not expected to vote for any Republican candidate.

;

;CNN reported that an expected 3 pm ET (1900 GMT) vote had been postponed as Scalise sought to firm up support.

;

;"We're working hard to get unified. We need to get unified because the world is not waiting," Scalise, 58, told reporters. "Obviously we still have work to do."

;

;At least four Republicans said they would not support Scalise in a floor vote.

;

;"It's not over yet. That was the inside race. Now the outside race starts," said Representative Thomas Massie, one of the Republican lawmakers opposing Scalise.

;

;Republicans picked Scalise over House Judiciary Committee chair Jim Jordan in a secret ballot vote behind closed doors.议员们表示，斯卡利斯的得票数为 113 票，乔丹的票数为 99 票。

;Scalise said his first action as speaker would be to schedule a vote on a resolution making clear that the United States stands with Israel in its war with Hamas ;militants; in Gaza.

;The US Supreme Court's conservative majority on Wednesday appeared poised to revive a Republican-drawn electoral map in South Carolina that was blocked by a lower court for racial bias after 30,000 Black residents were moved out of a ;congressional district;.

;

;During arguments in a case that could help decide control of the US House of Representatives in the 2024 elections, the conservative justices signaled sympathy toward arguments made by South Carolina officials defending the ;changes in composition; of the district as driven by partisan benefit for Republicans.

;

;At issue was a map adopted last year by the Republican-led state legislature that redrew the boundaries of one of South Carolina's seven US House of Representatives districts - one that includes parts of Charleston along the Atlantic coast.

;

;A federal three-judge panel in January ruled that the map sorted voters along racial lines and diminished the clout of Black voters in violation of the US Constitution's 14th and 15th Amendments, which guarantee equal protection under the law and prohibit race-based voting discrimination.

;

;Black voters tend to favor Democratic candidates.

;

;A practice called gerrymandering involves the manipulation of electoral district boundaries to marginalize a certain set of voters and increase the influence of others. In this case, the state legislature was accused of racial gerrymandering to reduce the influence of Black voters in South Carolina's 1st congressional district.

;

;Conservative Chief Justice John Roberts expressed skepticism that the plaintiffs - Black voters who challenged the map - met their burden in the case, noting that they challenged the it "without any direct evidence, with no alternative map, with no odd-shape districts which we often get in gerrymandering cases."

;

;Roberts added, "Have we ever had a case before where all it is is circumstantial evidence?"

;

;The Republican legislators and other state officials who appealed the lower court's ruling argued that the map was designed to secure partisan advantages, a practice that the Supreme Court in 2019 decided was not reviewable by federal courts - unlike racial gerrymandering, which remains illegal.

;

;Conservative Justice Neil Gorsuch wondered whether the challengers had overcome the presumption of good faith courts must give legislatures.

;

;"Here, there's no evidence that the legislature could have achieved its partisan tilt - which everyone says is permissible - in any other way," Gorsuch said.

;

;The new map increased the district's share of white voters while reducing its share of Black voters, which the lower court referred to as "bleaching." The Republicans faulted those judges for finding that the district's composition was motivated primarily by race rather than Republican interests.

;

;Leah Aden, a lawyer with the NAACP Legal Defense Fund who argued on behalf of challengers to the map, said the evidentiary record "reflects that there was a racial target, it reflects that there was a significant sorting of Black people, it reflects unrebutted expert evidence of race rather than party explaining the assignment of voters."

;

;The court's liberal justices questioned the arguments made to defend the map.

;
